sect1.title: Submitting a Port
sect1.para: Using a standardised approach to submitting the Portfiles and associated patches scripts, etc allows us to keep track of port submissions, process them efficiently and get them submitted as quickly as possible to our dports CVS tree. The following sections will describe the standard port submission procedures.

sect2.title: Where to Submit
sect2.para: New ports should be submitted via the Darwinports bugzilla tool. Your submission will be automatically emailled to the members of the darwinports-bugs mailing list. If you are uncertain about any aspect of your port, you may also want to email it with your questions and the bug number to DarwinPorts mailing list.

If you are submitting a modification to an existing port, please assign the port to the current maintainer in your bugzilla submission, so that the automatic email is directed to the maintainer, who will be best suited to deal with your submission.

sect2.title: Using Bugzilla to Submit a port
sect2.para: The following section describes in some more detail how to use Bugzilla to submit your port.

listitem.para: Make sure you select the Darwinports project.
Please assign updates and comments on existing ports to the maintainer. Otherwise, if this is a new port or an RFC, please leave blank
You may use this field to point to the portfile if it is available online, or to point to the homepage of the program project.
The summary field should one of a number of standardised elements,
Please use this format for the submission of new ports.
Please use this format for the submission of updates to ports.
Please use this format for the submission of changes to a current, uncommitted port submission
Please use this format for the submission of Request for Comments on a Portfile.
to add an attachment you will have use the query tool. Once you have selected the correct port, please use this format in the summary field for your submission.
The description field should contain the following information as per the example given here here.
listitem.programlisting:
Portname-1.2.3
the portfile can be found here: URL or ATTACHED or INLINE
Description: What does this program do in a nutshell, briefly what changes were made, or what files you are attaching in the tarball.
Homepage: URL of project or program itself, not the portfile
Comments: Any comments you have about your port, concerns, lookouts, dependencies that you may want to mention
================INLINE CONTENT================ -- your sig if you'd like

sect3.title: Final Comments on Port Submission
sect3.para:
The following general points should also be borne in mind when submitting to bugzilla:
Small changes or portfiles should be inlined. Larger changes should be attached as a single file, tar works wonderfully for this. Multiple patched files should be bundled together using tar and attached to the submission Currently attachments must be sent in using the current bug number, remeber to query bugzilla to find out the current bug number, select that bug and use the 'Create a New Attachment' link.
